item.description: Research Is there crowd out in mortgage refinance? (with Ryan Goodstein) We examine whether supply-side capacity constraints contribute to the well- documented “failure to refinance” among certain borrowers who would benefit financially from doing so. Using comprehensive loan-level data from the National Mortgage Database (NMDB), we show that marginal borrowers (e.g., lower credit score; lower income) have substantially lower mortgage prepayment rates during refinance booms compared to periods of lower refinancing activity.
